title: Dark and sumptuous chocolate cake
description: I never thought I would be in raptures about the joyfulness of a vegan chocolate cake. It’s true that I first made a version of it – the recipe kindly given to me by Caroline Stearns, my technical guru in the kitchen – when I was giving a supper for a vegan friend, but I now make this as my chocolate cake of choice, and I don’t even need to explain it’s vegan. On top of everything else, it’s incredibly simple to make. For this recipe you will need a leakproof 20cm/8in springform cake tin.
ingredients: 75g/2½oz coconut butter (this is not the same as oil)
150g/5½oz dark chocolate (minimum 70% cocoa solids), finely chopped
375ml/13fl oz hot water, from a recently boiled kettle
90ml/3fl oz (or 75g/2½oz if weighed when solid) coconut oil
1½ tsp cider vinegar or white wine vinegar
1 tbsp edible rose petals, to decorate
